body.name: A Lady’s Artful Courtship: A Historical Regency Romance Novel

productInformation.name: Best Sellers Rank

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Suspenseful intrigue and romance
reviews.reviewText: There is a great deal of informational backstory in the prolouge that has to do with the grandfather's time. Then, it immediately switches to our current characters that threw me off a little bit. But, that history becomes integral to the mystery as a whole. Both main characters are artists whose families have feuded in the past (prolouge) and meet by chance due to having their galleries shown together in London. This fated Romeo and Juilet pair have to figure out if true love is worth rocking the boat, and if some mysteries are worth solving. I love how both characters grow within the story and learn what is truly important to them. All wrapped up in an HEA it is a quite sweet finish to the whole ordeal.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A wonderful story that keeps you intrigued throughout
reviews.reviewText: I love the fact that you don’t know until the very end what really happens. You don’t know who the protagonist is, even though you have a suspicion it isn’t proven until the end. A really great story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Molly and John are both artists and are interconnected to each other through a family heirloom lost fifty years ago. Both families are involved with this missing family heirloom but why? To which family did the heirloom come from? How was it lost? The mystery is complicated due to the fact all people originally involved have passed. So how is all finally resolved and how do Molly and John find their hea despite their families feuding? Enjoy this sweet and clean to find out.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This story was so different from many of the other books that I have read lately. It was interesting and suspenseful. The characters were great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I had a hard time getting through the first few chapters but I'm glad I stuck with it. The excitement and intrigue built as the chapters progressed. The characters were engaging and lovable. Definitely worth the read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: What a tale about finding a mysterious jewel and how they go about finding it while finding love.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Treasure hunt romance
reviews.reviewText: This was another lovely offering by Alice Kirks. The two main characters, Molly and John, were well written. There was a mystery, a treasure hunt, romances, and some interesting plot twists. A fun read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I enjoyed the book.Simon’s storyline needed an ending.He was too evil to be left alone.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Wow! I love this book! I like how the past intrudes on the present (in the period it is set),how it influences the characters, and motivates them. I love that this is not all about balls and the pressure to marry even though there is a great romantic aspect to the story of course.Great characters, both main and minor ones, that you can relate to, smile at and sympathise with. I like the way the exhibition brings the main characters together along with the painting of the necklace encouraging the solving of the past’s mystery.The hints of danger, the creepy elements and somewhat reckless behaviour give pace to the story too.I still have a little issue with how long certain ‘trips’ would take (I know it is one of my foibles!) Watford is 20 miles from what, today, is Central London and would take half a day’s travel to get there in the Regency period. Also the trip to Norwood in South London …All that aside a great story that I will read again.I am an ARC reader and this my honest review.
Highly recommend this book by a great author

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: A very enjoyable read. The grandfathers of John and Molly had fallen out many years ago over a necklace. John was the son of the Duke of Hamilton but had been disowned because the Duke did not approve of his son being an artist. Molly was the daughter of Earl Norton and she was also a talented artist. They met at their joint art exhibition and found shared interests. In their families the story of the missing necklace had caused many disagreements between everyone. John and Molly decided to try to find the necklace. Their search led to burglary, assault and attempted murder before the necklace was found in a very unexpected place. Will John be brave enough to reveal his feelings for Molly? Will Molly return those feelings. Read on and enjoy this well-written story.

reviews.reviewTitle: An old mystery leads to love
reviews.reviewText: Two families and one necklace. Each family has their own story and John and Molly are caught in the middle. Both are artists and struggle against their attraction for each other due to their families’ grievances. They decide to solve the mystery and along the way acknowledge their love. Securing the necklace and overcoming a number of obstacles to find love and happiness is the culmination of the story. An engaging and well written story.
